thread.title: Cross Country Set to Run at Pair of Saturday Races
thread.title_full: Cross Country Set to Run at Pair of Saturday Races

title: Cross Country Set to Run at Pair of Saturday Races
text: Eden Meyer So. JACKSONVILLE, Fla. -- The North Florida Cross Country teams will have runners competing at a pair of events Saturday morning, as the men's squad heads to the Greater Louisville Classic and the women's team travels to the Upstate Invitational.The UNF men's team, currently ranked No. 5 in the South Region, will take a group of seven runners to Louisville, Ky., to run against some of the top squad's in the country on the course that will serve as host for the NCAA Championship meet. Women's top runner, , will also be racing in the event as an individual in the women's 5k. " Louisville is going to be another good opportunity for our men's team," said head coach Jeff Pigg . "We will have the chance to run against some out-of-region teams and compete with some top caliber programs. Louisville is hosting the NCAA Championship so a lot of quality teams have entered to race and see the course. We have been grinding in practice and some guys look great but a couple are a little banged up. Our focus remains to be running well at the end of the season. Eden is going to Louisville because she is a potential NCAA qualifier and is ready for a high level meet." The Osprey women's squad, ranked 12th in the South Region, has a full lineup ready to run in Spartanburg, S.C. A quartet of men's runners will also make the trip and run in the Upstate Invitational 8k race as individuals."The women will be going to USC Upstate, where we had a great meet last year," added Pigg. "We don't like to separate Eden from the rest of the group but it is important to do what is best for her. The women have been working hard and we are looking forward to some good results. Since we were limited to just seven runners in Louisville, we wanted to give our other guys a chance to get another race under their belts so we are sending
